condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, 80% of children living with HIV have access to quality care, treatment and nutritional services

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to the increasing number of children on anti-retroviral treatment by training and assessing facility readiness for new protocols. In addition, the CHAI partnership expanded POC technology allowing early detection of cases. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:19/01/2017

title.narrative: # & % of HIV positive children under 15 years of age that receive ARVs
% of PCR test results returned to health facility in < 28 days

actual.value: 2016:22.4 % of results were returned within 28 days.

title.narrative: # and % of HIV exposed children receiving ARV prophylaxis to prevent MTCT

actual.value: 2016:40,600 exposed children received ARV prophylaxis by end of June 2016.

title.narrative: Health facilities that provide paediatric ART

actual.value: 2016:1046 ART sites corresponding to 68% of HF; Total PMTCT sites 1,424, (1020 offering option B+)

title.narrative: ART guidelines incorporate priorities for adolescents.

National HIV Strategy and Plans for care and treatment that are aligned to the most recent WHO child and adolescent recommendations for care and treatment and included includes targets for children and adolescents
